description.S1: Now that you've found all of the engineering manuals,

blurb.B1: You'll gain Deserters Reputation and 300 Bit Cartridges for giving him the first volume.
blurb.B2: Deserters Reputation and 500 Bit Cartridges for the second.
blurb.B3: And, 8750 XP, Deserters Reputation and Electro-Charged Surface.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: Hey there.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Today's your lucky day, Thomas. I've got one of those datapads you wanted.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I want to ask you something.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I should go.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: No kidding. Really? Well, which one?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Part one. Found it in the community center archives.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Part two. Found it in the cannery.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: The elusive part three. Someone stashed it away inside the old geothermal plant.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Actually, I wanted to ask you something else.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: Look at that. "Building A Computing Machine Out Of Spectrum Potatoes: A Primer." I'm just glad it's survived all these years.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: That's a complete set. All three parts. I'm gonna be the greatest engineer Halcyon's ever seen.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: Two whole datapads. Be still my beatin' heart. Oh - almost forgot your payment.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: I appreciate you going through all that trouble.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: Um, aside from you, Ms. Parvati. I swear, I'll do you proud.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: I've been saving something for you. Just a little contraption I found. Should fit right into your outfit.

dialog.speaker: Parvati (Female)
dialog.utterance: I'm glad we could help, Thomas.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Hold on. I've got more for you.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll let you know if I find any others.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: Well don't keep me in suspense.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: Sure. I'd be glad to take 'em off your hands.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: One datapad's got enough to guide me down my newfound path. Just remember, I've got something saved for you if I find me all three.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: In fact, I put aside something special. On the off-chance that somebody'd search out those datapads for me.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: Ain't that just ironical? If I'd worked a little longer back at the cannery, I might've found this myself.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: The Geothermal Plant! Now that is just incredible. You really went exploring down there? Adelaide always told us it was swarming with hostile mechanicals.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: You're really playing with my feelings here.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: What's on your mind?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: How long have you lived here?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Never mind.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: Couple months. This camp is my home. People you see milling about? They're my family. Least I think of them that way.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: I owe them my life. Would've died in the wilderness if they hadn't chanced upon me, starving and delirious.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What were you doing out in the wilderness?

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: We all left the cannery for one reason or another. Me? I was let go. Mostly on account of my incompetence.

dialog.speaker: ThomasKemp (Male)
dialog.utterance: I mean, I was incompetent. I couldn't even survive on my own. Grace found me. Adelaide took me in. I've been on my feet ever since.
